Package mypackage

Class Commander

java.lang.Object
mypackage.Commander
public class Commander
extends java.lang.Object
The Commander class implements most of the features of the text editors and handles appropriately the list with the lines and various actions that are based on them. It uses an Indexer object in order to provide the required methods for the indexing procedures and searches.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private FileLine currentLine
    currentLine mebmer variable is used for keeping track of on which line we currently are among the list of file lines
    private int currentLineIDX
    currentLineIDX member variable is used for storing the number of the current line according to the lists
    private java.util.LinkedList<FileLine> fileLines
    The list of lines that are read from the file
    private java.lang.String fileName
    fileName member variable is used to store the name of the txt file provided
    private boolean fileOpened
    fileOpened member variable is used for knowning when a file is opened or not (true/false)
    private java.lang.String filePath
    filePath member variable is used to store the canonical path of the txt file provided
    private boolean idxDisplayed
    idxDisplayed member variable is used for knowning when to print the index of each line while printing them
    private Indexer indexer
    An Indexer object used for the indexing and search procedures on the file
    private static int MAX_CHARACTERS_PER_LINE
    A static member variable used to specify the max number of characters in a line
    private StandardReader reader
    A StandardReader object used for reading console input

    Class constructor with String and int arguments

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void addLineAft()
    Method used to add a new line after the current line after reading a specific text for it from the user It handles exceptions and error cases respectively and it uses the node references to reconnect the list nodes correctly.
    private void addLineBef()
    Method used to add a new line before the current line after reading a specific text for it from the user It handles exceptions and error cases respectively and it uses the node references to reconnect the list nodes correctly.
    private void binarySearch()
    Method that calls the method (Indexer.binarySearch()) for searching in a binary way for entries of a specific word in the indexing file
    private void checkFile​(java.io.File fileToCheck)
    Method that is used to check if a file provided meets some minimum requirements such as: - The file exists - The file is readable - The file is writable - The file path isn't empty or null - The file is a file and not a directory
    private void countLinesAndChars()
    A method that counts the lines and characters of the file by iterating through the list of lines for counting.
    private void createIndexFile()
    Method used to call the method of the Indexer used to build and write the indexing file.
    private void createNewFile()
    Method that is used to write the initial file created from the system if the user didn't provided a txt file when launching the program.
    void debug()
    Method that is used to print all the info about each line in the list
    private void deleteCurrentLine()
    A method for deleting the current line from the list and updating the references of the close-by nodes.
    private void editCurrentLine()
    Method used to edit the text of the line that corresponds to the currentLine member variable.
    void executeCommand​(java.lang.String cmd)
    Method that is used to invoke methods based on the input command using a switch case module.
    private java.lang.String getNewFileName()
    Method that creates a random String and appends to it the extension .txt so it can be used as file name.
    private java.lang.String getPrompt()
    Method used to create a String prompt to be displayed to the user.
    private void moveOneLineDown()
    Method to point the member variable currentLine to the next line of it, using its next reference
    private void moveOneLineUp()
    Method to point the member variable currentLine to the previous line of it, using its previous reference
    private void moveToFirstLine()
    Method to point the member variable currentLine to the first line of the list of lines.
    void moveToLastLine()
    Method to point the member variable currentLine to the last line of the list of lines.
    private void parseFile()
    Method that is used to read the txt file provided, create the list of lines and set all the needed variables appropriately.
    private void printCurrentLine()
    A method for printing the current line by using the currentLine and currentLineIDX member variables.
    private void printCurrentLineIDX()
    A method for printing the current line index by using the currentLineIDX member variable.
    private void printFileWords()
    Method used to call the method Indexer.print(), using the indexer object declared earlier, that prints the words written in the indexing file.
    private void printLines()
    A method that prints all the lines of the file by iterating through the lists in which they are stored.
    private java.lang.String readCommand()
    Method that is used to read a String command from the console and return it.
    private FileLine readNewLine()
    Method used to read console input and return it as a FileLine object, ready to be inserted in the list.
    private void serialSearch()
    Method that calls the method (Indexer.serialSearch()) for searching in a serial way for entries of a specific word in the indexing file
    private void toggleIdx()
    Method to invert the boolean member variable idxDisplayed which specifies if the number of the line is displayed or not while printing the list
    java.lang.String validateCommand()
    Method that checks if a command is: - 1 character long - not empty - not null
    private void writeFileToDisk()
    Method used to write and save the file to the disk.

  • Constructor Details

    • Commander

      public Commander​(java.lang.String pth, int MAX_CHARS)
      Class constructor with String and int arguments
      Parameters:
      pth - The path of the file to be edited (Can be left empty)
      MAX_CHARS - The max number of characters per line allowed to be read

  • Method Details

    • printLines

      private void printLines()
      A method that prints all the lines of the file by iterating through the lists in which they are stored.

    • countLinesAndChars

      private void countLinesAndChars()
      A method that counts the lines and characters of the file by iterating through the list of lines for counting.

    • printCurrentLine

      private void printCurrentLine()
      A method for printing the current line by using the currentLine and currentLineIDX member variables.

    • printCurrentLineIDX

      private void printCurrentLineIDX()
      A method for printing the current line index by using the currentLineIDX member variable.

    • deleteCurrentLine

      private void deleteCurrentLine()
      A method for deleting the current line from the list and updating the references of the close-by nodes. It works for first and last lines too by catching exceptions and errors. It handles each case respectively. After each successful delete the first line of the list becomes the first line The list stores at least one line, even if it's emtpy. In order to avoid conflicts, omissions and errors in the indexing process it is obligatory to re-index the file after changes have been done.

    • toggleIdx

      private void toggleIdx()
      Method to invert the boolean member variable idxDisplayed which specifies if the number of the line is displayed or not while printing the list

    • moveToFirstLine

      private void moveToFirstLine()
      Method to point the member variable currentLine to the first line of the list of lines.

    • moveOneLineUp

      private void moveOneLineUp()
      Method to point the member variable currentLine to the previous line of it, using its previous reference

    • moveToLastLine

      public void moveToLastLine()
      Method to point the member variable currentLine to the last line of the list of lines.

    • moveOneLineDown

      private void moveOneLineDown()
      Method to point the member variable currentLine to the next line of it, using its next reference

    • readNewLine

      private FileLine readNewLine()
      Method used to read console input and return it as a FileLine object, ready to be inserted in the list. For the reading of the console input the reader object (StandardReader) is used.
      Returns:
      FileLine object with the user input as text member variable

    • editCurrentLine

      private void editCurrentLine()
      Method used to edit the text of the line that corresponds to the currentLine member variable. In order to avoid conflicts, omissions and errors in the indexing process it is obligatory to re-index the file after changes have been done.

    • addLineAft

      private void addLineAft()
      Method used to add a new line after the current line after reading a specific text for it from the user It handles exceptions and error cases respectively and it uses the node references to reconnect the list nodes correctly. It also modifies the user's input to meet the max number of characters per line requirements. In order to avoid conflicts, omissions and errors in the indexing process it is obligatory to re-index the file after changes have been done.

    • addLineBef

      private void addLineBef()
      Method used to add a new line before the current line after reading a specific text for it from the user It handles exceptions and error cases respectively and it uses the node references to reconnect the list nodes correctly. It also modifies the user's input to meet the max number of characters per line requirements. In order to avoid conflicts, omissions and errors in the indexing process it is obligatory to re-index the file after changes have been done.

    • writeFileToDisk

      private void writeFileToDisk()
      Method used to write and save the file to the disk. Because it's meaningless to track changes in the list every time we want to save the file we overwrite it by writing line by line to the disk.

    • printFileWords

      private void printFileWords()
      Method used to call the method Indexer.print(), using the indexer object declared earlier, that prints the words written in the indexing file.

    • binarySearch

      private void binarySearch()
      Method that calls the method (Indexer.binarySearch()) for searching in a binary way for entries of a specific word in the indexing file

    • serialSearch

      private void serialSearch()
      Method that calls the method (Indexer.serialSearch()) for searching in a serial way for entries of a specific word in the indexing file

    • createIndexFile

      private void createIndexFile()
      Method used to call the method of the Indexer used to build and write the indexing file.

    • debug

      public void debug()
      Method that is used to print all the info about each line in the list

    • parseFile

      private void parseFile()
      Method that is used to read the txt file provided, create the list of lines and set all the needed variables appropriately. If the user hasn't provided a txt file while launching the program, then a new one is created automatically after the user is asked for permission.

    • getNewFileName

      private java.lang.String getNewFileName()
      Method that creates a random String and appends to it the extension .txt so it can be used as file name.
      Returns:
      String: the random file name.

    • createNewFile

      private void createNewFile()
      Method that is used to write the initial file created from the system if the user didn't provided a txt file when launching the program.

    • checkFile

      private void checkFile​(java.io.File fileToCheck) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Method that is used to check if a file provided meets some minimum requirements such as: - The file exists - The file is readable - The file is writable - The file path isn't empty or null - The file is a file and not a directory
      Parameters:
      fileToCheck - File object to be checked
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if at least one of the requirements above isn't met.

    • readCommand

      private java.lang.String readCommand()
      Method that is used to read a String command from the console and return it.
      Returns:
      String : the command read from the console

    • validateCommand

      public java.lang.String validateCommand() throws BadCommandException
      Method that checks if a command is: - 1 character long - not empty - not null
      Returns:
      The command that was read if it's valid
      Throws:
      BadCommandException - if at least one of the requirements above is not met

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand​(java.lang.String cmd) throws BadCommandException, TerminateException
      Method that is used to invoke methods based on the input command using a switch case module.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The valid command the user gave in the console
      Throws:
      BadCommandException - if a not valid command arrives here
      TerminateException - when the appropriate command is given and the program terminates

    • getPrompt

      private java.lang.String getPrompt()
      Method used to create a String prompt to be displayed to the user. It is formed in 2 ways: - FILENAME/cmd: (The user knows on which file he is taking action) - cmd: (When a file is either not specified nor created.
      Returns:
      String : The prompt to be displayed to the user
